title: Hangs on startup
body:
OS: Linux
Version: alacritty 0.13.1
Wayland (ChromeOS 121.0.6167.131 beta)

Alacritty is hanging on startup. This started with version 0.13. It sometimes starts successfully, about 15% of the time, but otherwise it hangs in the same place every time:

<details>
<summary>WAYLAND_DEBUG=1 alacritty --print-events -vvv --config-file /dev/null</summary>

```
¶ WAYLAND_DEBUG=1 alacritty --print-events -vvv --config-file /dev/null
```

</details>

The relevant lines:

```
[4010733.809] wp_fractional_scale_v1@30.preferred_scale(120)
[4010733.896] xdg_toplevel@28.configure(0, 0, array[0])
[4010733.917] xdg_surface@27.configure(19268)
[4010733.987]  -> xdg_surface@27.ack_configure(19268)
[4010738.591] wl_display@1.delete_id(31)
…
[4010886.827] wl_callback@31.done(19268)
```

If you're clever, you can spot the bug from here, especially when compared to a successful run.

```
[ 547457.855] wl_display@1.delete_id(31)
[ 547457.881] wp_fractional_scale_v1@30.preferred_scale(120)
[ 547458.012] xdg_toplevel@28.configure(0, 0, array[0])
[ 547458.051] xdg_surface@23.configure(22088)
[ 547458.067] wl_callback@31.done(22088)
[ 547458.123]  -> xdg_surface@23.ack_configure(22088)
```

In that 150ms gap, a different thread drove wayland-backend into a deadlock.

This starts with commit https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/80d4daccc307622f8e604af4f36ac89ecccf5db7, and can be further isolated to just the copypasta update. The copypasta update can be isolated to https://github.com/alacritty/copypasta/commit/6bc2ea66f108a21f0009b315438c286371cafbf0, a smithay-clipboard update. The relevant smithay-clipboard commit is https://github.com/Smithay/smithay-clipboard/commit/31392200dcecbeb17672ee735ff2fc92620fa379, which overhauls the entire event loop handling.

The previous version of smithay-clipboard was polling every 50ms; the current version dispatches the event queue properly. As such, events can be delivered to the main queue when the main thread is not the one performing the read, and we hit a deadlock in wayland-rs.

https://github.com/Smithay/wayland-rs/blob/2d5e7df99f896fadcd0165f4d958fcb6b43522cb/wayland-client/src/event_queue.rs#L464-L483

The `Err` result of `dispatch_inner_queue` is ignored as documented, but if it returns `Ok` with something greater than 0, that is ignored. This causes `blocking_dispatch` to assume that there were no pendings events and so it should block until there are some. That causes this loop to get stuck, as `done` is true but we're blocking on the read:

https://github.com/Smithay/wayland-rs/blob/2d5e7df99f896fadcd0165f4d958fcb6b43522cb/wayland-client/src/event_queue.rs#L430-L432

And indeed, if I adjust the scale factor on my system, it unblocks and finishes starting up.

It's unclear to me why `dispatching_impl` needs to read the queue in two different ways, or whether smithay-clipboard or alacritty are somehow violating the threading requirements of wayland-rs, but this patch fixes it for me. https://github.com/Smithay/wayland-rs/pull/695
